byline.contributor: Annie Correal and Tatiana Schlossberg contributed reporting.

abstract: Many New York city dog owners welcome possibility that New York State health regulations banning dogs from restaurants might soon be loosened; legislation currently before State Legislature would allow restaurants to individually decide whether to allow patrons to bring dogs into their outdoor dining areas.
lead_paragraph: A bill before the New York State Legislature would give restaurants the option of allowing dogs into back gardens and sidewalk patios when accompanied by a human diner.

headline.main: Hold the Mimosa. I’ll Have a Biscuit.
headline.print_headline: Hold the Mimosa. I’ll Have a Biscuit.

snippet: A bill before the New York State Legislature would give restaurants the option of allowing dogs into back gardens and sidewalk patios when accompanied by a human diner.
